You may drive more slowly than the posted speed limit, based on road conditions, but it is illegal to drive any faster than the posted speed limit.

questions.question: If you can see that the roadway up ahead is covered by heavy smoke, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn on your four-way flashers and continue.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed, move as far to the right as possible, and stop off the roadway.
questions.answerC: Turn on your high beam headlights and continue.
questions.explanation: If you notice that the road ahead is covered by heavy smoke, reduce your speed immediately, drive as far as possible to the right, and stop off the roadway. Only then should you determine if it is safe for you to continue. Remember that certain kinds of smoke can irritate your eyes and lungs or even kill you.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Lane reduction; the right lane ends soon.
questions.answerC: Highway entrance ramp ahead.
questions.answerD: Lane reduction; the left lane ends soon.
questions.explanation: This sign indicate that the right lane ends ahead.

questions.question: An orange and red triangular sign on a vehicle always means:
questions.answerC: Shoulder work ahead.
questions.explanation: Slow-moving vehicles, such as farm tractors, road maintenance vehicles, and animal-drawn carts, display an orange and red triangle on the back.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerC: Curve ahead.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

questions.question: What is the purpose of rumble strips?
questions.answerA: They alert drivers to potential tire problems.
questions.answerB: They test a vehicle's shock absorbers.
questions.answerC: Through vibration and sound, they alert inattentive drivers to the fact that their vehicles have left the travel lane.
questions.explanation: Rumble strips create noise and vibrations to warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are straying off of the road or are approaching a stop sign or signal.

questions.question: Fines for speeding are ____ in work zones.
questions.answerC: Tripled
questions.explanation: Fines for moving traffic violations are doubled in work zones where workers are present, as well as in school zones during indicated hours. Always drive with caution when near children, workers, and other pedestrians.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection with a steady yellow traffic light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a safe stop.
questions.explanation: When a steady yellow light appears on a traffic signal, you should prepare to stop. If you are already within the intersection, you should clear the intersection as quickly as possible.

questions.question: Drivers must be careful when passing large vehicles and should avoid driving beside large vehicles for long periods of time.
questions.explanation: Because large vehicles have large blind spots on both sides, you should avoid driving beside a large vehicle for a long period of time. It is safest for you to either drop back or move forward when you find yourself directly next to a large vehicle.

questions.question: When passing another vehicle on a road with two lanes traveling in opposite directions, you should:
questions.answerA: Return to the driving lane when there's enough room between you and the vehicle you passed.
questions.answerB: Remain in the left lane if you intend to turn left.
questions.answerC: Return to the right side of the roadway immediately.
questions.explanation: When passing another vehicle on a two-lane roadway, you must return to the right side of the roadway when there is enough room between you and the vehicle you have passed.

questions.question: Vehicle stopping distances never depend on:
questions.answerC: The condition of your vehicle's brakes.
questions.answerD: The condition and type of your vehicle's tires.
questions.explanation: The distance that a vehicle needs to stop depends on the motorist's reaction time, weather and visibility conditions, the vehicle's weight, the conditions of the vehicle's brakes, the condition and type of the vehicle's tires, roadway conditions, and speed.

questions.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. Your best action is to:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Apply the brakes sharply to stop.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection.
questions.answerD: Be prepared to stop before the intersection.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow traffic light indicates that the light will soon change to red. You should be prepared to stop for the red light, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Side road.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that there is an upcoming sharp turn and that they should lower their speed accordingly.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.answerC: Turn.
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: To prevent yourself from becoming an aggressive driver:
questions.answerB: Drive above the posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: Tailgate the driver in front of you.
questions.explanation: To prevent yourself from becoming an aggressive driver, concentrate on driving and don't take the actions of other drivers personally. Be realistic about your travel time, drive within posted speed limits, and be forgiving of other drivers using the roadway.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerC: Slippery when wet
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road may be slippery when wet. Exercise caution when driving on a slippery road.

questions.question: At a four-way stop, the driver on the right should insist on the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Never insist on having the right-of-way. Always yield your legal right-of-way when it can prevent an accident.

questions.question: If your vehicle has a mechanical problem:
questions.answerA: Signal and pull into the slow lane.
questions.answerB: Stop in your lane and put on your hazard lights.
questions.answerC: Put on your hazard lights and pull off the road.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle breaks down on a highway, make sure other drivers can see it. Get your vehicle off the road and away from traffic if at all possible and turn on your emergency flashers to show that you are having trouble.

questions.question: Children up to age 18 are prohibited from riding in cargo areas.
questions.explanation: Children up to age 18 are prohibited from riding in the cargo area of a vehicle. They must be safely secured in a safety belt or child safety seat while in a moving vehicle.

questions.question: Your tire blows out while you are driving. You should:
questions.answerB: Hold your steering wheel tightly and slow to a stop.
questions.answerC: Keep driving normally.
questions.answerD: Turn on your emergency flashers and continue driving.
questions.explanation: If you experience a tire blowout, do not immediately apply the brakes. Grip the steering wheel firmly and steer to remain in your traffic lane. Reduce your speed gradually by releasing the accelerator and staying off the brakes. Once you are moving very slowly, apply the brakes lightly and pull off the road into a safe area.

questions.question: Driving at night requires increased caution because:
questions.answerB: There is a larger volume of traffic at night.
questions.answerC: Drivers cannot see as well at night.
questions.answerD: Accidents occur more frequently at night.
questions.explanation: Because it is dark, drivers cannot see as well at night as they can during the day. From one half hour after sunset until one half hour before sunrise, or at any other time when persons or vehicles are not visible for 500 feet, drivers must use their headlights.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerB: Slow down and do not use your brakes.
questions.answerC: Slow down; slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that the road ahead becomes slippery when wet.

questions.question: Never park within ____ of a fire hydrant.
questions.answerC: 15 feet
questions.explanation: Parking within 15 feet of a fire hydrant is prohibited. Only park where it is safe and legal to do so.

questions.question: Drivers who refuse to submit to chemical testing when requested to do so by an officer will lose their license for:
questions.answerC: One year.
questions.explanation: Nebraska has an Implied Consent Law. This means that by driving in the state, you have agreed to undergo a chemical test if asked to do so by a law enforcement officer. If you refuse to submit to such a test, your license can be administratively revoked for one year.

questions.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:
questions.answerB: Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
questions.answerC: Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

questions.question: If you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
questions.answerB: Lock the ignition and remove the key.
questions.answerC: Set the parking brake.
questions.explanation: When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must stop the engine, lock the ignition, remove the key from the ignition, and set the parking brake.

questions.question: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and:
questions.answerA: Expect traffic to allow you to proceed into the lane, since you have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Wait for the lane to clear before merging.
questions.explanation: Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

questions.question: At a four-way stop:
questions.answerA: The driver to arrive first has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver to arrive last has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver should continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should wave the other drivers ahead.
questions.explanation: At four-way stops, traffic from all four directions must stop. The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first. If two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

questions.question: You are driving on a divided multilane highway and see or hear the signal of an approaching emergency vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Slow down, move your vehicle to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle, and stop.
questions.answerD: Increase your speed to get out of the way of the emergency vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle, you must slow down, provide a clear path for the vehicle, and stop. Don't try to outdrive the emergency vehicle.

questions.question: Road markings are used to guide and regulate traffic. Broken white lines:
questions.answerA: Indicate that there is two-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Indicate that you are in a no passing zone
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. Broken lines may be crossed with care.

questions.question: Fines for speeding are tripled in work and school zones.
questions.explanation: Fines for moving traffic violations are doubled in work zones where workers are present, as well as in school zones during indicated hours. Always drive with caution when near children, workers, and other pedestrians.

questions.question: You must yield to other drivers:
questions.answerA: When entering a street from a garage or alley.
questions.answerB: When they are on a road to your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
questions.answerC: When your traffic signal is a green arrow.
questions.explanation: You must yield to other drivers when entering a street from an alley, driveway, or garage. You must also yield to pedestrians who are on an intersecting sidewalk.

questions.question: It is important to be alert to motorcycles because:
questions.answerA: They are more difficult to see than cars.
questions.answerC: Motorcyclists are less skilled drivers than other motorists.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are smaller and harder to see than cars. Because of their size, they are easily hidden in a car’s blind spot. It may be difficult to judge your distance to a motorcycle and difficult to tell how fast a motorcycle is moving, so always be alert and extra cautious when near a motorcyclist.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates a low ground railroad crossing. Where this sign is present, railroad tracks cross the road at a steep slope and the bottom of low vehicles may drag or get caught on the tracks.

questions.question: Turning left at a red light is never permitted.
questions.explanation: Unless prohibited by a sign, drivers may turn left on a solid red light from a one-way street onto another one-way street. There are no other situations in which a driver may turn left when stopped at a solid red traffic light.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that two lanes of traffic going the same direction will soon merge into one lane.

questions.question: Nebraska law requires drivers who change their name or address to apply to the County Treasurer for a replacement operator's license within:
questions.answerC: 90 days.
questions.explanation: You must apply at a Driver Licensing Office if your name has changed. Apply at a Driver Licensing Office or online if your address has changed. In either case, this must be done within 60 days of the change.

questions.question: Only ____ can reduce blood alcohol content (BAC) and alcohol's effects on the body.
questions.answerC: Time
questions.explanation: Only the passage of time can remove alcohol and its impairing effects from the body.

questions.question: When changing lanes, you can check your blind spots by:
questions.answerC: Using both inside and outside rearview mirrors.
questions.answerD: Turning your head and looking over your shoulder.
questions.explanation: You should turn your head to check your blind spots before every lane change.

questions.question: Before turning, you should:
questions.answerC: Increase your speed.
questions.explanation: To complete a turn safely, you should activate your turn signal three to four seconds before your turn.

questions.question: On a freeway, you should look farther ahead than you would on a city street:
questions.answerA: In order to see potential hazards early.
questions.answerB: Because it takes a quarter of a mile to stop your vehicle completely.
questions.answerC: Because it helps you keep up with traffic.
questions.explanation: On the freeway, be ready for changes in traffic conditions. Watch for signals from other drivers. Expect merging vehicles at on-ramps and interchanges and be prepared for rapid changes in road conditions and traffic flow.

questions.question: No vehicle may follow any fire apparatus responding to an emergency at a distance closer than:
questions.answerC: 500 feet.
questions.explanation: You may not follow within 500 feet of a fire apparatus that is responding to an emergency. Do not park within a block of where a fire apparatus has stopped to answer an emergency.

questions.question: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their:
questions.answerC: Parking lights.
questions.explanation: Use low beam headlights when driving in rain, snow, sleet, or fog. High beam headlights in adverse weather conditions lower visibility by reflecting off the precipitation and back into the driver's eyes.

questions.question: Blind spots are:
questions.answerA: Spots in your vision when you become fatigued.
questions.answerB: Areas of the road that cannot be seen in a vehicle's mirrors.
questions.answerC: Traffic control devices.
questions.explanation: When changing lanes, look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move. Check for obstructions near the rear corners of your vehicle. These areas are called “blind spots” because you cannot see them by using your mirrors.

questions.question: A steady green traffic light at an intersection means:
questions.answerC: You may continue through the intersection at a safe and reasonable speed, if it is clear to do so.
questions.explanation: A steady green traffic light indicates that the driver may continue through the intersection. The driver should yield to traffic or pedestrians already in the intersection and proceed when the intersection is clear.

questions.question: It is unlawful to:
questions.answerA: Pass in any marked no passing zone.
questions.answerB: Pass within 300 feet of a railroad crossing.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: There are a number of locations where it is unlawful for drivers to pass. Passing is prohibited within 100 feet of a railroad crossing, within 100 feet of an intersection, and within any other designated no passing zone.

questions.question: When operating a motor vehicle, it is a secondary offense to use a handheld wireless communication device:
questions.answerA: To read, type, or send written communication.
questions.answerC: As a GPS navigation device.
questions.explanation: It is a secondary offense to use a handheld wireless communication device to read, type, or send written communication while operating a motor vehicle. Violation of this law will result in a fine ranging from $200 to $500.

questions.question: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:
questions.answerA: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
questions.answerC: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.
questions.explanation: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

questions.question: Your following distance when driving behind a motorcycle should:
questions.answerA: Be the same as it would be if following any other vehicle.
questions.answerC: Increase.
questions.explanation: When following a motorcycle, allow a greater following distance than you would when following any other vehicle. Motorcycles are able to stop and turn more quickly than larger vehicles and a driver following a motorcyclist needs time to react to their quick movements.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A green arrow:
questions.answerA: Is used only on one-way streets.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic must turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerC: Means that you may proceed, but only if the green arrow is accompanied by a circular green light.
questions.answerD: Points the way to an airport.
questions.explanation: A green arrow has the same meaning as a circular green traffic light, but traffic in the indicated lane must turn in the direction shown by the arrow.

questions.question: If a traffic signal is not working and no officer is in place to direct traffic, what should you do?
questions.answerA: Treat the intersection as if it is controlled by yield signs.
questions.answerB: Treat the intersection as an all-way stop.
questions.answerC: Allow drivers on major streets to have the right-of-way.
questions.answerD: Continue through the intersection without stopping.
questions.explanation: If a traffic signal is not working and no officer is present to direct traffic, treat the intersection the same as you would treat an all-way stop. Be prepared to yield your legal right-of-way to avoid any traffic accidents.

questions.question: The most frequent cause of motorcycle accidents is:
questions.answerA: The driver of a passenger vehicle failing to yield the right-of-way and making a left turn in front of an oncoming motorcycle.
questions.answerC: Inadequate road conditions.
questions.explanation: Approximately one-third of all motorcycle crashes involve a second motor vehicle. Many motorcycle accidents are caused by the driver of a passenger vehicle turning left in front of an oncoming motorcycle instead of properly yielding the right-of-way.

questions.question: Compared to driving during the day, driving at night is:
questions.answerC: More dangerous.
questions.explanation: Driving at night is more dangerous than driving during the day for several reasons. It is harder to see in the dark, you may be temporarily blinded by the glare from other vehicles' lights, and there are likely to be more drivers on the road who are tired or under the influence.

questions.question: When driving in a work zone, you should:
questions.answerB: Stay alert, obey all posted signs, maintain a safe speed, and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so as not to impede traffic.
questions.explanation: In a work zone, you should stay alert, obey any posted signs, and maintain a steady speed consistent with the flow of traffic, unless directed otherwise. Adjust your lane position to allow space for workers and equipment. Be prepared to stop at any time.

questions.question: When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS) should:
questions.answerB: Press and hold the brake pedal firmly.
questions.answerC: Stay off the brakes and wait for the car to drift to a stop.
questions.explanation: When driving a vehicle equipped with an Anti-Lock Braking System (ABS), a driver should press the brake pedal firmly when stopping on a snowy or icy surface. The ABS will pump the brakes more rapidly than a driver would be able to.

questions.question: What are the colors of warning signs indicating upcoming hazards?
questions.answerA: Black letters or symbols on a white background
questions.answerB: Black letters or symbols on a yellow background
questions.answerC: White letters or symbols on a blue background
questions.answerD: White letters or symbols on a green background
questions.explanation: Warning signs that indicate approaching hazards are usually yellow with black lettering or symbols. Warning signs in work zones are orange with black lettering or symbols.

questions.question: If you park facing uphill on a street with a curb, set the parking brake and:
questions.answerA: Turn the front wheels toward the curb.
questions.answerB: Turn the front wheels away from the curb.
questions.answerC: Leave the front wheels straight.
questions.explanation: When parking uphill on a road that has a curb, your wheels should be turned away from the curb. When parking uphill on a street without a curb or when parking downhill, your wheels should be turned toward the curb or edge of the road.

questions.question: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the left.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the right.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

questions.question: Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian who is:
questions.answerC: Crossing any street.
questions.explanation: Drivers must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians who are crossing the street in any marked or unmarked crosswalk. In the interest of safety, drivers should yield the right-of-way to people crossing any street.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: Regulation signs regulate traffic speed and movement, displaying rules which drivers must obey. This sign tells drivers the direction in which they must drive when turning onto a one-way street.

questions.question: If you want to turn left at an intersection controlled by this signal, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn, as long as you yield to others drivers.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop and proceed when it is safe.
questions.answerC: Come to a full stop and remain stopped while the red arrow is activated.
questions.explanation: If you want to turn left at an intersection controlled by a traffic signal displaying a red arrow that is pointing left, you must come to a complete stop before reaching the intersection, stop line, or crosswalk. Remain stopped as long as the red arrow is present.

questions.question: This is a ____ sign.
questions.answerC: Yield
questions.explanation: This triangular sign is a "Yield" sign. When you see this sign, you must slow down to check for traffic and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and approaching cross traffic. Stop only if it is necessary to do so.

questions.question: Headlights must be used:
questions.answerC: After 8 p.m. and before 7 a.m.
questions.explanation: Your vehicle's headlights must be activated between sunset and sunrise. Use headlights any time you are driving under conditions that lower visibility.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Lane ends.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

questions.question: If you are driving near a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane.
questions.answerB: Drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
questions.answerC: Allow the motorcycle to use only half of a lane.
questions.answerD: Pass using the same lane as the motorcycle.
questions.explanation: A motorcycle is a full-size vehicle with the same privileges as any other vehicle on the roadway. You should allow a motorcyclist a full lane width. Although it may seem as though there is enough room in the traffic lane for a larger vehicle and a motorcycle, remember that the motorcycle needs room to maneuver safely.

questions.question: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should:
questions.answerA: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your left.
questions.answerB: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.
questions.answerC: Wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection before proceeding.
questions.explanation: If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that is not controlled by signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way. Drivers should then proceed in the order that they arrive to the intersection.

questions.question: This yellow warning sign means:
questions.answerA: You are approaching a school or school crosswalk.
questions.answerB: Slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: This sign is placed on roads near schools to warn drivers to slow down, drive with caution, and watch for children.

questions.question: If you need to drive in foggy weather:
questions.answerA: Turn on your low beam headlights.
questions.answerC: It is okay to drive at the maximum speed limit.
questions.answerD: Do not drive at a speed above 10 miles per hour.
questions.explanation: You are required to use your headlights during the day when visibility is reduced to 500 feet or less. When you first turn on your headlights, be sure they are adjusted to the low beam setting. Using high beams in fog or rain will cause the light to reflect back into your eyes, lowering visibility even more.

questions.question: Passing is prohibited:
questions.answerC: At railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: Locations where it is unlawful and unsafe to pass another vehicle include hills, curves, intersections, and railroad crossings.

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding funeral procession escort vehicles?
questions.answerA: They are classified as emergency vehicles.
questions.answerB: They are not considered emergency vehicles.
questions.answerC: They are considered emergency vehicles only when escorted by a police vehicle.
questions.explanation: Funeral procession escort vehicles are classified as emergency vehicles. Drivers are required to yield to funeral escort vehicles which are displaying proper audio or visual signals.

questions.question: You are on the freeway and traffic is merging into your lane. You should:
questions.answerA: Make room for the merging traffic, if possible.
questions.answerB: Assert your right-of-way by driving faster.
questions.answerC: Always maintain your position.
questions.explanation: When traffic permits, you should make room to allow vehicles to merge into your lane.

questions.question: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:
questions.answerA: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.
questions.answerB: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
questions.answerC: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.
questions.explanation: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

questions.question: A speed limit is:
questions.answerA: The maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under dangerous conditions.
questions.answerB: The maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions.
questions.answerC: The suggested speed to travel on a road under ideal conditions.
questions.explanation: A speed limit is the maximum or minimum legal speed you can travel on a road under ideal conditions. You may drive more slowly than the posted speed, but it is illegal to drive any faster. You must drive more slowly where signs or signs indicate a school zone or work zone speed limit. If conditions such as road construction or bad weather make the posted speed unsafe, drive under the speed limit.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Turn around.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a roundabout is ahead. Enter a roundabout at a low speed and yield to existing traffic.

questions.question: A broken yellow centerline means that:
questions.answerB: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.answerC: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

questions.question: You are driving on a city street and see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you. What should you do?
questions.answerA: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down.
questions.answerB: Drive to the right edge of the road and stop.
questions.answerC: Stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and lights. Drive to the right edge of the road and stop until the emergency vehicle has passed. If you are within an intersection, drive through the intersection first and then stop.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You can travel in either direction in this lane.
questions.answerC: You are approaching a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic.

questions.question: The minimum legal driving speed when traveling on the interstate is:
questions.answerC: 60 mph.
questions.explanation: The minimum speed limit on interstate highways in Nebraska is 40 miles per hour. Only drive under the minimum speed limit if conditions require it.

questions.question: Nebraska's speed law requires you drive:
questions.answerB: Five miles per hour above the posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: At a speed that is reasonable and safe under existing conditions.
questions.explanation: Nebraska's speed law requires driving at a speed that is reasonable and safe under existing conditions, within the posted speed limit. Reduce your speed any time conditions are less than perfect.

questions.question: A bicyclist who doesn’t obey traffic laws:
questions.answerA: Is in the right because bicyclists don’t have to obey traffic laws.
questions.answerC: Will always receive a warning from law enforcement.
questions.explanation: All bicyclists have the same rights, duties, and responsibilities as drivers of motor vehicles. Motorists and bicyclists who do not obey traffic laws can be ticketed.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerB: You must bear either right or left.
questions.answerC: A four-way intersection is ahead.
questions.answerD: A road joins from the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a Y intersection ahead. You must bear either to the right or to the left.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection where a traffic signal is displaying a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a safe stop.
questions.explanation: At an intersection controlled by a steady yellow light, you should bring your vehicle to a safe stop. If you are already within the intersection when the light changes from green to yellow, continue through the intersection at a safe speed.

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about drinking alcohol and driving?
questions.answerA: If you can walk in a straight line after drinking, it is safe to drive.
questions.answerB: If you are under the legal blood alcohol concentration limit, your driving isn't impaired.
questions.answerC: Alcohol affects judgement, which is needed to drive safely.
questions.explanation: Being under the influence of alcohol affects your judgment. Good judgement is necessary to react appropriately to things that you see or hear while on the road. Even if you are below the legal blood alcohol limit, consuming any amount of alcohol is likely to affect your ability to drive safely.

questions.question: Highway pavement will be particularly treacherous and most slippery:
questions.answerA: If it has been raining several hours.
questions.answerB: If it has just begun to rain.
questions.answerC: If it has been raining for one to two hours.
questions.explanation: Pavement is particularly treacherous when it first begins to rain. Accumulations of dirt and oil mix with the rainwater, creating a greasy film on the roadway.

questions.question: If an emergency or road assistance vehicle is stopped on the side of the road while using its flashing lights, an approaching driver must:
questions.answerB: Move into a lane at least one travel lane away from the stopped vehicle, if possible.
questions.answerC: Speed up to pass the stopped vehicle.
questions.answerD: Pull onto the left shoulder and stop.
questions.explanation: If you encounter a stopped emergency or road assistance vehicle that is using its flashing lights, merge into a lane that is at least one travel lane away from the stopped vehicle. If it is not safe or legal to change lanes, you must slow down and maintain a safe speed while passing the vehicle.

questions.question: When driving on the interstate, slower traffic should:
questions.answerC: Keep to the left.
questions.explanation: On an interstate highway, slow traffic should keep to the right. The left lane is intended for use by faster-moving vehicles to pass slower-moving vehicles.

questions.question: At intersections with a "Yield" sign, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is near enough to cause conflict.
questions.answerB: Yield the right-of-way only to vehicles on your right.
questions.answerC: Always slow down and proceed without stopping.
questions.explanation: At a yield sign, you must slow down or stop, if necessary, and give the right-of-way to crossing or merging vehicles. Yield the right-of-way to any cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.answerC: Curves right.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: When driving past a vehicle that has just stopped in a parked position on the side of the road, you should:
questions.answerA: Assume that the driver will open the car door as you approach.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes.
questions.answerD: Assume that the driver will wait for you to pass before opening the door.
questions.explanation: When passing a vehicle that has just parked parallel to the road, you should assume the driver will open the door as you approach. Use extra caution when driving near parked vehicles.

questions.question: Never drive a vehicle through, around, or under any railroad gate or barrier.
questions.explanation: Never drive through, around, or under gates or barriers at a railroad crossing. It is illegal and very dangerous.

questions.question: A diamond-shaped sign:
questions.answerA: Warns of existing or possible hazards.
questions.answerC: Alerts drivers to public recreation areas.
questions.answerD: Alerts drivers to upcoming food and gas locations.
questions.explanation: Diamond-shaped signs warn drivers of existing or potential driving hazards. You will usually see these signs in yellow or orange.

questions.question: On long trips, you can prevent drowsiness by:
questions.answerC: Stopping at regular intervals for a rest.
questions.answerD: Moving your eyes from side to side as you drive.
questions.explanation: To prevent drowsiness on long trips, you should schedule regular stops. Give yourself time to rest and stretch, even if you are not feeling tired.

questions.question: When riding in a vehicle, small children:
questions.answerA: May be safely held by a strong adult.
questions.answerB: Will be safe if they are standing on the floor in the back of the vehicle.
questions.answerC: Will not be hurt in an accident because they are small.
questions.answerD: Must never be allowed to ride while standing in the vehicle.
questions.explanation: Special child seats are available for children who are too small to wear regular safety belts. No person is strong enough to safely hold onto a child of any size during an accident or sudden stop. Never allow a child to ride in a vehicle unless they are properly fastened into a seat.

questions.question: Interstate driving requires drivers to:
questions.answerA: Have the ability to safely drive at increased speeds.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Safe use of the interstate demands drivers be constantly alert and capable of driving at high speeds.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection that is controlled by a flashing red traffic signal, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.
questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red traffic signal the same as you would treat a stop sign. Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: To turn left from a multilane one-way street onto a one-way street, you should start your turn from:
questions.answerA: Any lane (as long as it is safe).
questions.answerB: The lane closest to the left curb.
questions.answerC: The lane in the center of the road.
questions.explanation: When turning left from a one-way street onto another one-way street, you should begin the turn from the far left lane.

questions.question: If you are being passed in a no passing zone, you should:
questions.answerC: Slow down and let the other driver safely return to the drive lane.
questions.explanation: Passing areas are based on how far ahead drivers can see. Allow the passing vehicle to re-enter the drive lane as easily as possible to help everyone avoid potential upcoming hazards.

questions.question: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light changes from green to solid yellow, you should:
questions.answerB: Continue moving steadily and clear the intersection safely.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.
questions.explanation: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light changes from green to yellow, you should continue moving and clear the intersection safely.

questions.question: A broken yellow line beside a solid yellow line indicates that:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the solid yellow line.
questions.answerB: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.answerC: Passing is permitted from the lane next to the broken yellow line.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means that traffic in the lane next to the broken line may cross the line to pass, while traffic in the lane next to the solid line may not.

questions.question: The most effective safety restraints in a traffic crash are:
questions.answerA: Only a lap and shoulder belt.
questions.answerC: Both a lap/shoulder belt and an airbag.
questions.explanation: Safety belts can double your chance of surviving a crash and more than double your chance of avoiding serious injury. Airbags, when used properly with safety belts, provide additional protection in a front-end crash. You should wear both shoulder and lap belts.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerC: Stop sign.
questions.explanation: A downward-facing triangular sign is always a yield sign. Drivers must be prepared to slow down or stop when approaching a yield sign.

questions.question: The Child Passenger Restraint Law requires that all children up to age ____ ride properly secured in a federally-approved child safety seat.
questions.answerC: Eight
questions.explanation: When in a moving vehicle, children up to age six must ride properly secured in a federally-approved child safety seat.

questions.question: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:
questions.answerA: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Large trucks and buses have air brakes and cannot stop as quickly as smaller vehicles can.
questions.answerC: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher rate of speed than smaller vehicles.
questions.explanation: While automobiles have hydraulic brakes, large trucks and buses have air brakes. Air brakes do not operate as quickly as hydraulic brakes, so large trucks and buses cannot stop as quickly as smaller vehicles can.

questions.question: Sudden wind gusts on highways:
questions.answerA: Generally affect only the movement of large vehicles.
questions.answerC: Can cause problems for all vehicles.
questions.explanation: While it can create special problems for large vehicles, strong wind can cause problems for all drivers. Wind can lower visibility by blowing dirt and dust into the roadway, but it can sometimes also physically move a vehicle.

questions.question: Before turning right on a solid red traffic light, a driver should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed without stopping, if the way is clear.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop, look in both directions, and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and other traffic.
questions.answerC: Maintain their speed because they have the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Unless prohibited by posted signs, you may turn right at a red light. Before making the turn, come to a complete stop, look both ways, and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and other traffic.

questions.question: You may not park:
questions.answerC: On a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane.
questions.answerD: Within 12 inches of the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: There are a number of locations where it is unlawful to park, including on a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane. When parking on the street, you must be within 12 inches of the side of the road.

questions.question: You are driving on the freeway behind a large truck. You should drive:
questions.answerA: Closer behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerB: Farther behind the truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle.
questions.answerC: To the right side of the truck and wait to pass.
questions.explanation: It is necessary to follow farther behind a large truck than you would if following a passenger vehicle because trucks have larger blind spots.

questions.question: To avoid glare from the headlights of an approaching car:
questions.answerA: Look briefly toward the right side of the road.
questions.answerB: Stay focused on the centerline on the road.
questions.answerC: Flash your high beams.
questions.explanation: You should avoid looking toward the bright lights of an oncoming vehicle by glancing toward the right side of the road. After looking briefly toward the side of the road, continue looking ahead to check on the position of the other vehicle.

questions.question: As you approach an intersection with a flashing yellow light:
questions.answerB: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Wait for a green light before proceeding.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means that you should slow down, check for cross traffic, and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When driving at night, you should:
questions.answerB: Look directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle.
questions.answerC: Increase your following distance.
questions.explanation: Increase your following distance when it is difficult to see due to darkness. Use headlights to increase visibility, following the rules for proper use of high beams and low beams. Avoid looking directly at the headlights of an oncoming vehicle to avoid being blinded by the glare.

questions.question: If you drive more slowly than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
questions.answerA: Interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
questions.answerC: Demonstrate defensive driving techniques.
questions.explanation: You must drive more slowly than usual when there is heavy traffic or bad weather. However, if you block the normal and reasonable movement of traffic by driving too slowly, you may be cited. You should match the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

questions.question: You may cross double yellow lines to pass another vehicle if the:
questions.answerA: Vehicle in front of you moves to the right to let you pass.
questions.answerB: Yellow line next to your side of the road is broken.
questions.answerC: Yellow line next to the opposite side of the road is broken.
questions.explanation: A broken yellow line in the center of the road indicates that traffic next to the broken yellow line may pass, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If you come to an intersection and your view to the side is blocked, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and look both ways.
questions.answerB: Maintain your speed and look both ways.
questions.answerC: Stop, then inch forward until you can see clearly in both directions.
questions.explanation: Drivers must slow down when approaching an intersection. If a clear view of cross traffic is obscured, a driver should come to a stop and inch forward until they can see clearly in both directions.

questions.question: Failure to secure child passengers in a safety belt or child safety seat is punishable by:
questions.answerA: A fine and one point assessed against the driver.
questions.answerB: Two points assessed against the driver.
questions.answerC: Two points and court costs assessed against the driver.
questions.explanation: Children under age 18 must be secured in a safety belt or child safety seat when riding in a motor vehicle. If cited for violation of this requirement, a driver may be fined $25 (plus court costs) and incur one point on their driving record.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Lane ends.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the right lane ends ahead. A merging maneuver will be required for drivers in that lane.

questions.question: On a green arrow, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield to any vehicle, bicycle, or pedestrian in the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield to pedestrians only in the intersection.
questions.answerC: Wait four seconds before proceeding.
questions.explanation: A green arrow means "go." You must turn in the direction the arrow is pointing after you yield to any vehicles, bicycles, or pedestrians who are still in the intersection.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe practice.
questions.answerB: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
questions.answerC: The speed at which you drive a vehicle does not affect safety.
questions.explanation: Driving too slowly can be dangerous because it may cause drivers behind you to become frustrated and make dangerous moves to pass you. It is safest to drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit.

questions.question: If you are turning onto a street with more than one lane traveling in your direction, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.answerB: Turn into the lane marked with an arrow.
questions.answerC: Turn into the middle lane.
questions.explanation: When turning onto a street with more than one lane moving in the direction that you are traveling, turn into the lane that is closest to your previous lane. Do not change lanes when turning.

questions.question: A major cause of rear-end collisions in work zones is:
questions.answerA: One driver driving at a different speed than surrounding traffic.
questions.answerB: The lack of work zone barricades alerting drivers to road maintenance.
questions.answerC: Construction equipment obstructing drivers' views.
questions.explanation: Driving slower or faster than surrounding traffic is a major cause of rear-end collisions in work zones. When driving in a maintenance area, be alert to surrounding traffic and posted speed limits.

questions.question: When approaching a person who is crossing the street while using a white cane or guide dog, you should:
questions.answerA: Stop until the person is well away from your path of travel.
questions.answerB: Honk your horn as you proceed past them.
questions.answerC: Carefully drive around them.
questions.explanation: When approaching a pedestrian who is using a white cane or guide dog while crossing the street, you must stop until the person is well away from your path of travel. Always yield the right-of-way to blind pedestrians.

questions.question: Which of the following influence(s) the effects of alcohol?
questions.answerA: The amount of food in the stomach
questions.answerB: The body weight of an individual
questions.answerC: How much time passes between drinks
questions.explanation: Your blood alcohol content (BAC) depends on how much alcohol you drink, how much time passes between drinks, and your weight. Eating before or while you drink helps slow the absorption of alcohol somewhat, but it cannot prevent intoxication or impairment if you have too much to drink.

questions.question: You have the right-of-way when turning left on which of the following traffic signals?
questions.answerC: A green arrow pointing left
questions.explanation: A green steady arrow means you may pass through the intersection in the direction that the arrow is pointing. Oncoming traffic is required to stop for turning traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: T intersection.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming traffic signal. They should be prepared to respond to a yellow light, red light, and/or cross traffic.

questions.question: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?
questions.answerB: Right, toward the side of the road
questions.answerC: Left, toward the center of the road
questions.explanation: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

questions.question: When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Stop only if pedestrians are on the sidewalk.
questions.answerB: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.
questions.answerC: Expect pedestrians on the sidewalk to yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

questions.question: This sign means you are approaching a railroad crossing that does not have a signal. You should:
questions.answerB: Proceed at a consistent speed while looking and listening for approaching trains.
questions.answerC: Slow down, look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby.
questions.explanation: At a railroad crossing marked with this sign, a driver should look both ways, listen for any trains, and be prepared to stop if any trains are nearby. Never try to outdrive an oncoming train.

questions.question: Which of the following is a dangerous habit when driving in work zones?
questions.answerB: Failing to carefully watch for workers and moving equipment
questions.answerC: Both of the above
questions.explanation: When driving in a work zone, adjust your speed for the traffic conditions and don't follow other vehicles too closely. Be attentive to workers and machines in the work zone.

questions.question: If you are driving on a highway next to a single broken white line marking:
questions.answerA: You cannot cross the line to pass.
questions.answerB: You may cross the line to pass and change lanes.
questions.answerC: You may only cross the line to change lanes if you are in the left lane.
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. You may cross a dashed white line to pass or change lanes if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
questions.answerA: Wait to proceed until you have a clear view of all tracks.
questions.answerB: Stop on the first railroad track and watch for another train.
questions.answerC: Go through as soon as the train passes.
questions.answerD: Go through when one of the tracks is free.
questions.explanation: If you are stopped at a railroad crossing with more than one track, do not start moving as soon as a train passes. Wait until you have a clear view down all tracks before you start across. Even where there is only one track, do not start across immediately after a train passes; check again for another train that may be approaching.

questions.question: When changing lanes you should not:
questions.answerA: Check your side and rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Give a turn signal to signal your intentions.
questions.answerC: Check for other drivers who may be moving into the same lane as you.
questions.answerD: Use your cell phone to contact the police to determine if the road ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check your side and rearview mirrors for traffic approaching you from behind. Use your turn signal to let other drivers know you plan to change lanes. Check for other drivers who also may be moving into the same lane.

questions.question: Which of the following best ensures your safety and the safety of those around you when you are backing your vehicle?
questions.answerA: Honk your horn right before shifting into reverse.
questions.answerB: Check behind the vehicle before you get into the driver's seat.
questions.answerC: Check your rearview mirrors to see what is behind you.
questions.answerD: Turn up the car radio before backing up to get the attention of anyone who may be around you.
questions.explanation: Backing requires extra caution because it is difficult for drivers to see behind their vehicles. Before entering a vehicle to back up, walk to the back of the vehicle to check for children and small objects.

questions.question: If someone has consumed alcoholic drinks, what will help the person overcome the influence of those drinks?
questions.answerC: Fresh air
questions.explanation: Only the passage of time will allow a person to overcome the influence of alcohol.

questions.question: This red and white sign means you should:
questions.answerA: Stop and check for traffic coming from both directions before proceeding.
questions.answerB: Give the right-of-way to traffic on the road you wish to enter or cross.
questions.answerC: Maintain a steady speed and check for traffic coming from all directions.
questions.explanation: A three-sided yield sign indicates that you must slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary, to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. In this case, you do not have the right-of-way.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing yellow light, drivers should:
questions.answerC: Turn on their headlights.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light warns of a hazard. Slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: Nebraska law requires drivers who change their name or address to apply to the County Treasurer for a replacement operator's license within:
questions.answerC: 90 days.
questions.explanation: You must apply at a Driver Licensing Office if your name has changed. Apply at a Driver Licensing Office or online if your address has changed. In either case, this must be done within 60 days of the change.

questions.question: When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
questions.answerA: Cross the tracks immediately and as quickly as possible.
questions.answerB: Always stop before crossing the tracks.
questions.answerC: Prepare to yield to any train at the crossing.
questions.answerD: Speed up to beat any oncoming train.
questions.explanation: Always be prepared to yield to any oncoming trains before crossing railroad tracks, particularly if there are no lights or gates controlling the crossing. Never start to cross the tracks until there is room for your entire vehicle on the other side of the tracks. Due to the risk of a vehicle stalling, it is not wise to shift gears when crossing railroad tracks.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about traveling in a vehicle equipped with airbags?
questions.answerA: A safety belt should not be worn by the driver of a vehicle equipped with airbags.
questions.answerB: When combined with safety belts, airbags provide improved protection in a crash.
questions.answerC: Children age 12 and under can safely sit in the front seat of a car that is equipped with airbags.
questions.explanation: When combined with safety belts, airbags provide improved protection. They are an additional safety feature that do not replace safety belts. Because airbags pose a risk of injury to children, passengers age 12 and under should ride in the rear seat.

questions.question: You are crossing an intersection and an emergency vehicle is approaching while using its siren and flashing lights. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately in the intersection until it passes.
questions.answerB: Pull to the right of the intersection and stop.
questions.answerC: Continue through the intersection, pull to the right, and stop.
questions.explanation: If you are in an intersection when you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights and/or siren, continue through the intersection and then drive to the right and stop. You must yield the right-of-way to any police vehicle, fire engine, ambulance, or other emergency vehicle using a siren or flashing lights.

questions.question: When approaching an uncontrolled intersection, a driver should:
questions.answerB: Stop at the intersection, check in all directions, and proceed.
questions.answerC: Yield to all other drivers.
questions.explanation: At an intersection where there is no stop sign or traffic signal, you should yield to a vehicle approaching the intersection from the right. However, always be prepared to yield to avoid a crash. Do this by taking your foot off the accelerator, covering the brake, and looking left, right, and left again.

questions.question: Drivers may park in the handicap parking access aisles located directly beside handicap parking stalls.
questions.explanation: It is prohibited for anyone to park in handicap parking access aisles. These aisles are meant to provide space for wheelchairs and wheelchair lifts.

questions.question: When driving in a work zone, you should:
questions.answerB: Stay alert, obey all posted signs, maintain a safe speed, and be prepared to stop.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so as not to impede traffic.
questions.explanation: In a work zone, you should stay alert, obey any posted signs, and maintain a steady speed consistent with the flow of traffic, unless directed otherwise. Adjust your lane position to allow space for workers and equipment. Be prepared to stop at any time.

questions.question: At dawn or dusk and in rain or snow, it can be hard to see and be seen. A good way to let other drivers know you are there is to turn:
questions.answerC: On your headlights.
questions.explanation: You must use your headlights at any time when conditions prevent you from seeing other vehicles and when it may be difficult for other drivers to see you. Always use your low beam headlights if weather conditions require you to use your windshield wipers.

questions.question: What does this road sign mean?
questions.answerC: Steep hill
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually yellow with black markings. This sign indicates that you are approaching a steep hill. Slow down and be ready to shift to a lower gear to control your speed and protect your brakes from damage.

questions.question: If an emergency or road assistance vehicle is stopped on the side of the road while using its flashing lights, an approaching driver must:
questions.answerB: Move into a lane at least one travel lane away from the stopped vehicle, if possible.
questions.answerC: Speed up to pass the stopped vehicle.
questions.answerD: Pull onto the left shoulder and stop.
questions.explanation: If you encounter a stopped emergency or road assistance vehicle that is using its flashing lights, merge into a lane that is at least one travel lane away from the stopped vehicle. If it is not safe or legal to change lanes, you must slow down and maintain a safe speed while passing the vehicle.

questions.question: The amount of alcohol in the blood is referred to as:
questions.answerC: Rate of alcohol consumption (RAC).
questions.explanation: Blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is a measurement of the percentage of alcohol in the blood. The higher the BAC number, the more impaired a person is.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Lane ends.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming intersection.

questions.question: When encountering an aggressive driver, you should:
questions.answerA: Avoid eye contact, slow down, and let them pass.
questions.answerB: Cut them off to slow them down.
questions.answerC: Retaliate by tailgating them.
questions.answerD: Make sure they know you disapprove of their behavior.
questions.explanation: If another driver is threatening you or intentionally driving dangerously around you, remain calm and try to put as much distance between the two of you as possible. Slow down and let them pass. Do not make eye contact and do not make obscene gestures.

questions.question: Collisions are more likely to happen when:
questions.answerA: All vehicles are traveling at about the same speed.
questions.answerB: One lane of traffic is traveling faster than the other lanes.
questions.answerC: One vehicle is traveling faster or slower than the flow of traffic.
questions.explanation: Collisions are more likely to happen when one driver moves faster or slower than the other vehicles on the road. Driving faster than other traffic increases your chance of being involved in a collision. Driving more slowly than other traffic is also dangerous because it can increase the risk of a rear-end collision with your vehicle or cause other drivers to swerve to avoid hitting you.

questions.question: Except when passing, maintain a following distance of at least ____ when driving behind working snow removal vehicles.
questions.answerC: 500 feet
questions.explanation: Except when passing, you may follow working snow removal or maintenance vehicles at a distance no closer than 100 feet. Snow removal equipment may reduce visibility by creating clouds of snow. Driving too closely to one of these vehicles may put your vehicle at risk of being struck by flying chunks of snow, sand, or ice.

questions.question: Having a driver license is a:
questions.answerC: Right.
questions.explanation: It is important to remember that driving is a privilege and that all drivers play a role in ensuring that everyone remains safe on the roadways. If you prove to be abusive of that privilege, the privilege may be revoked.

questions.question: At intersections with a "Yield" sign, you must:
questions.answerA: Yield the right-of-way to cross traffic that is near enough to cause conflict.
questions.answerB: Yield the right-of-way only to vehicles on your right.
questions.answerC: Always slow down and proceed without stopping.
questions.explanation: At a yield sign, you must slow down or stop, if necessary, and give the right-of-way to crossing or merging vehicles. Yield the right-of-way to any cross traffic that is close enough to cause conflict.

questions.question: Children up to age 18 are prohibited from riding in cargo areas.
questions.explanation: Children up to age 18 are prohibited from riding in the cargo area of a vehicle. They must be safely secured in a safety belt or child safety seat while in a moving vehicle.

questions.question: Rumble strips are present to:
questions.answerA: Warn drowsy or inattentive drivers that they are leaving the road.
questions.answerB: Indicate that a stop is ahead.
questions.answerC: Help slow a vehicle that is experiencing brake failure.
questions.explanation: Shoulder rumble strips are a series of indented or raised elements installed on a paved roadway near the travel lane. The purpose of a rumble strip is to create noise and vibrations to alert an inattentive driver to the fact that they have left the travel lane.

questions.question: This sign indicates that the road ahead:
questions.answerC: Curves right.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of a reverse curve in which the road curves to the right, then to the left.

questions.question: Which of the following are used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
questions.answerC: White lines on the side of the road
questions.answerD: White arrows in the middle of the lanes
questions.explanation: Arrows may be used to indicate which lanes should be used for specific purposes, such as driving straight or making a turn.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle on any hill:
questions.answerA: One of your rear wheels should touch the curb.
questions.answerB: Use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in "park."
questions.answerC: Your front wheels should be parallel to the road, if there is no curb.
questions.explanation: When parking on a hill, you should always leave your vehicle in gear or in the "park" position. If there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail. If there is a curb, the front wheels should be turned toward it (if headed downhill) or away from and gently touching it (if headed uphill).

questions.question: Distracted driving may be caused by:
questions.answerB: Talking or texting on a cellular phone.
questions.answerC: Changing a radio station or CD.
questions.explanation: It is estimated that drivers make 200 decisions for every mile traveled, making it vital that drivers focus their full attention on the task of driving. Performing any additional task can create a dangerous distraction.

questions.question: Certain highway signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Such signs are known as:
questions.answerC: Information signs.
questions.explanation: Regulatory signs require drivers to obey an indicated instruction. Failure to comply is subject to penalty.

questions.question: "No zones" are areas around trucks where cars:
questions.answerA: Disappear into blind spots or are so close that they restrict the truck driver's ability to stop and maneuver safely.
questions.answerB: Have sufficient space to travel behind the truck.
questions.answerC: Have several car lengths between their vehicle and the truck.
questions.explanation: "No zones" are areas around trucks or buses in which cars disappear into the larger vehicle's blind spots. "No zones" can also be defined as areas in which cars are so close to the larger vehicle that they restrict the truck or bus driver’s ability to stop and maneuver safely. A car being in a "No zone" greatly increases the potential for a crash.

questions.question: At a four-way stop:
questions.answerA: Drivers may insist on the right-of-way, even at the risk of an accident.
questions.answerB: The driver who arrives first to the intersection should proceed first.
questions.answerC: Drivers may slow down and proceed, if the road is clear.
questions.explanation: The driver to arrive first to a four-way stop should be the first to continue through the intersection. Drivers may proceed through the intersection in the order that they arrived.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Construction ahead.
questions.explanation: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases when stopping:
questions.answerA: On a wet or icy road.
questions.answerC: When driving at night.
questions.explanation: Stopping distances increase on wet or icy roads. Stopping distances also increase on road surfaces covered in loose gravel or stones.

questions.question: The Child Passenger Restraint Law requires that all children up to age ____ ride properly secured in a federally-approved child safety seat.
questions.answerC: Eight
questions.explanation: When in a moving vehicle, children up to age six must ride properly secured in a federally-approved child safety seat.

questions.question: When making an emergency roadside stop, you should:
questions.answerA: Flash your headlights to warn other drivers.
questions.answerB: Shift your transmission to the parking gear and set the parking brake.
questions.answerC: Leave your vehicle running and exit the vehicle.
questions.explanation: When making an emergency roadside stop, you should first signal and pull over. Get as far off the road as safely possible before shifting the transmission to the parking gear and setting the parking brake. Activate the emergency flashers, turn off the engine, and remove the keys. Check traffic before getting out of the vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: No passing zone.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should:
questions.answerC: Use your low beam headlights.
questions.explanation: Drivers should use low beam headlights when driving in fog. High beams will reflect back at the driver, making it difficult to see.

questions.question: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light changes from green to solid yellow, you should:
questions.answerB: Continue moving steadily and clear the intersection safely.
questions.answerC: Increase your speed so you do not cause an accident.
questions.explanation: If you are already within an intersection when the traffic light changes from green to yellow, you should continue moving and clear the intersection safely.

questions.question: The effect that lack of sleep has on your safe driving ability is the same as:
questions.answerC: The effect that anger has.
questions.answerD: The effect that driving with teenagers has.
questions.explanation: Fatigue and being under the influence of alcohol have similar effects on your ability to drive safely. For example, being awake for 18 hours impairs your driving about as much as a blood alcohol level of 0.05 percent. Being awake for 24 hours in a row has the same effect on your driving as a blood alcohol level of 0.10 percent.

questions.question: When turning left, drivers must yield the right-of-way to:
questions.answerA: Other drivers who are already in the intersection.
questions.answerC: Pedestrians who are already in the intersection.
questions.explanation: When turning left, drivers must yield the right-of-way to oncoming traffic. Drivers must also always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians, bicyclists, and other drivers who are already in the intersection.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Reserved parking for persons with disabilities.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates parking spaces that are reserved for vehicles displaying Persons with Disabilities license plates, Disabled Veteran license plates, and/or disabled parking placards.

questions.question: Increase your following distance when driving behind a large vehicle:
questions.answerA: To better see around the sides of the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Because other drivers tend to pull behind large vehicles before trying to pass them.
questions.answerC: Because following too closely will get you caught in the vehicle's slipstream.
questions.explanation: Drivers of trucks, buses, vans, and any vehicles pulling campers or trailers may not be able to see you if you are driving directly behind them. Increase your following distance when driving behind one of these vehicles. Additionally, large vehicles can block your view of the road, so increase your following distance to look around the sides of the vehicle and see the road ahead.

questions.question: Drivers should maintain a minimum following distance of:
questions.answerC: Seven seconds.
questions.explanation: A driver should allow a space of at least three seconds between their vehicle and the vehicle ahead. Drivers should always increase their following distance when conditions are less than perfect.

questions.question: It is legal to make a left turn at a red traffic light after stopping only if:
questions.answerA: You are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.
questions.answerB: You are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
questions.answerC: You yield to all other traffic at the intersection.
questions.explanation: After coming to a complete stop, you may turn left at a red light only if you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street. Only make the turn if there are no posted signs prohibiting such a turn.

questions.question: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:
questions.answerC: Turn.
questions.explanation: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: When driving at night, using only your parking lights is unlawful.
questions.explanation: It is unlawful to drive at night using only your parking lights. Drivers are required to use their headlights when driving in the dark.

questions.question: When driving on an interstate, to avoid traffic merging from on-ramps to your right, the best thing to do is to:
questions.answerC: Maintain your speed and position.
questions.explanation: When driving on an interstate highway, be aware of upcoming on-ramps. When traffic permits, move out of the right-hand lane to allow vehicles to enter from the on-ramps to your right.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.answerC: Do not pass.
questions.explanation: Solid yellow lines on two-lane roads indicate zones where passing is prohibited. If a solid yellow line appears next to a broken yellow line, drivers in the lane nearest to the solid yellow line may not pass. In some instances, both yellow lines will be solid, indicating that it is not safe to pass from either direction.

questions.question: Road markings are used to guide and regulate traffic. Broken white lines:
questions.answerA: Indicate that there is two-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Indicate that you are in a no passing zone
questions.explanation: White lines separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. Broken lines may be crossed with care.

questions.question: You may pass another vehicle if the line dividing your lane from the lane you wish to enter is a ____ line.
