questions.answerB: Move into the right lane and drive slowly until the vehicle has passed.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the curb or edge of the road and stop until the vehicle has passed.
questions.explanation: If you see an emergency vehicle approaching while using its flashing lights, pull over to the right edge of the road and stop. Position yourself parallel to the curb. On one-way streets, drive toward the road edge nearest you.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Yield the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is an intersection with a side road ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Steep downgrade ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a steep downgrade is ahead on the road. Drivers should check their brakes.

questions.question: You are driving when your power steering stops working. You should:
questions.answerA: Honk your horn and turn off the ignition.
questions.answerB: Turn on your hazard lights and brace yourself.
questions.answerC: Work hard to steer, reduce your speed, drive to a safe area, and stop.
questions.explanation: If your power steering stops working, additional effort will be required to maintain steering control. Reduce your speed and pull off the roadway to stop in a safe area.

questions.question: When merging onto a freeway, it is usually best to:
questions.answerA: Proceed slowly while waiting for an opening.
questions.answerB: Accelerate to a speed that is faster than the speed of traffic.
questions.answerC: Turn on your hazard lights until safely on the freeway.
questions.answerD: Accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic.
questions.explanation: When entering a freeway, use the on-ramp to accelerate to the speed of freeway traffic so you can blend in smoothly and safely. Entering traffic must yield to traffic already on the freeway.

questions.question: You may pass another vehicle:
questions.answerA: In a curve or on a hill because the chance is small that another vehicle is coming.
questions.answerB: By using the shoulder of the highway.
questions.answerC: If your lane is next to a solid yellow line and the passing lane is clear ahead.
questions.explanation: You may not pass another vehicle on a hill or in a curve because you cannot see oncoming traffic and may cause a collision. Never pass another vehicle by driving onto the shoulder of a highway. Passing another vehicle by driving over a solid yellow line is prohibited.

questions.question: Roads with double solid yellow line markings down the center indicate that passing is:
questions.answerB: Allowed only from your direction of travel.
questions.answerC: Not allowed from either direction.
questions.explanation: A double solid yellow line down the center of a road indicates that traffic is moving in opposite directions and that passing is not allowed from either direction.

questions.question: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:
questions.answerA: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.
questions.answerC: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.
questions.explanation: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

questions.question: When driving under icy or snowy conditions, which driving technique will help drivers avoid crashes?
questions.answerA: Add extra weight to their vehicles to improve traction.
questions.answerB: Get off the highways as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Engage the four-wheel drive on their vehicles.
questions.answerD: Reduce their speed and increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: Reduce your speed when roads are snow-covered or icy. Doing this and increasing your following distance are the most important techniques for avoiding crashes under snowy or icy conditions.

questions.question: You have stopped for a train at a railroad crossing. After the train passes, you should:
questions.answerA: Wait for signal lights to stop flashing.
questions.answerC: Both of the above.
questions.explanation: Even after a train passes, watch out for a second train approaching on any track. Do not proceed until all gates have been lifted and all warning signals have stopped flashing.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?
questions.answerA: Slower traffic must keep to the right.
questions.answerC: If you miss your exit, you must go to the next exit.
questions.explanation: You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Cars on the right move first.
questions.answerC: Let cross traffic pass before proceeding.
questions.explanation: When approaching this sign, you must yield the right-of-way. Slow down and let vehicles and pedestrians crossing your path pass before you proceed. If necessary, stop before going ahead.

questions.question: Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the centerline.
questions.explanation: When there is a solid and a broken yellow line separating two lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions, a driver may pass only when the broken yellow line is nearest to the driver’s lane.

questions.question: While driving at night, you may use your parking lights instead of headlights.
questions.explanation: It is unlawful to drive at night using only your parking lights. You must use your headlights when driving in lowered visibility.

questions.question: If you are driving near a large commercial vehicle, you should:
questions.answerA: Follow the large vehicle closely to reduce wind drag on your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Avoid driving beside it for long stretches of time.
questions.answerC: Drive on its right side when on curves and hills.
questions.explanation: Because large commercial vehicles have large blind spots on each side, you should avoid driving beside them for long periods of time.

questions.question: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and:
questions.answerA: Expect traffic to allow you to proceed into the lane, since you have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Wait for the lane to clear before merging.
questions.explanation: Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

questions.question: When driving in rain, you must:
questions.answerC: Use parking lights.
questions.explanation: In rainy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights.

questions.question: Motorists are not required to yield to pedestrians if they are walking against the traffic light.
questions.explanation: You must always yield the right-of-way to pedestrians. Be aware of the possibility that pedestrians may misjudge traffic signals and cross against a light.

questions.question: Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot when:
questions.answerA: Pulling toward or away from a curb.
questions.answerC: Changing lanes.
questions.explanation: Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot every time you want to change your vehicle's position. If you are turning, changing lanes, or pulling toward or away from a curb, you should check your blind spots.

questions.question: If you reach an intersection where you wish to turn but you are not in the proper lane, you should:
questions.answerA: Quickly cut across traffic to make your turn.
questions.answerB: Turn on your blinker and make the turn from your current lane.
questions.answerC: Drive to the next intersection and make your turn then.
questions.answerD: Safely change lanes then put your vehicle in reverse to go back to the intersection.
questions.explanation: Never make last-minute turns. If you reach an intersection where you wish to turn but you are not in the proper lane to make the turn, drive to the next intersection and then make the turn from the proper lane.

questions.question: When stopped at a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if you:
questions.answerA: First come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Are in the proper lane and the intersection is clear.
questions.explanation: You may proceed in the direction that a green arrow signal is pointing if you are in the proper lane, regardless of any other signals that are displayed. Before turning, you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and vehicles already within the intersection.

questions.question: You are approaching an intersection where a traffic signal is displaying a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Reduce you speed and proceed carefully through the intersection.
questions.answerC: Come to a safe stop.
questions.explanation: At an intersection controlled by a steady yellow light, you should bring your vehicle to a safe stop. If you are already within the intersection when the light changes from green to yellow, continue through the intersection at a safe speed.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: A sudden change in weather calls for a change in driving.
questions.answerB: You should slow down when driving in rain and fog.
questions.answerC: Be particularly aware of vehicles coming up behind you in inclement weather.
questions.explanation: If the weather changes suddenly, you will need to adjust your driving to adapt. Always slow down when driving in rainy or foggy conditions. Be especially aware of vehicles behind you that may be going too fast for conditions.

questions.question: To improve visibility lowered by rain or fog, drivers should use their:
questions.answerC: Parking lights.
questions.explanation: Low beam headlights should be used when driving in rainy or foggy weather. Even if they do little to help you see, low beams will make it easier for others to see you.

questions.question: You may drive around the gates at a railroad crossing:
questions.answerC: When the lights have stopped flashing.
questions.answerD: When other drivers drive around the gates.
questions.explanation: You are required to stop at all railroad crossings when signals warn of an approaching train. These signals may include flashing red lights, a lowered crossing gate, a flagger signaling, or a train’s audible signal of warning. Do not attempt to go around a lowered gate.

questions.question: If you want to turn left at an intersection controlled by this signal, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn, as long as you yield to others drivers.
questions.answerB: Come to a full stop and proceed when it is safe.
questions.answerC: Come to a full stop and remain stopped while the red arrow is activated.
questions.explanation: If you want to turn left at an intersection controlled by a traffic signal displaying a red arrow that is pointing left, you must come to a complete stop before reaching the intersection, stop line, or crosswalk. Remain stopped as long as the red arrow is present.

questions.question: This sign means that:
questions.answerA: A community service group is picking up trash along the highway ahead.
questions.answerB: Workers are on or very close to the road in the work zone ahead.
questions.answerC: Children are at play ahead.
questions.answerD: There is a pedestrian crosswalk ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that workers may be on or very close to the roadway ahead, so you should take special care when traveling through the area.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection that is controlled by a flashing red traffic signal, you must:
questions.answerA: Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, then proceed.
questions.answerB: Reduce your speed and proceed with caution.
questions.answerC: Come to a complete stop and remain stopped as long as the light is red.
questions.explanation: Treat a flashing red traffic signal the same as you would treat a stop sign. Come to a complete stop, yield to oncoming traffic or pedestrians, and proceed when the way is clear.

questions.question: When approaching a steady yellow traffic light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Accelerate to avoid a red light.
questions.answerB: Continue driving, as they have the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: Slow to a stop, unless they are already within the intersection.
questions.answerD: Check to see what the cars next to them are doing.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow traffic light indicates that a red light is about to appear. Stop unless you are already within the intersection.

questions.question: If driving in fog, a driver should turn on the high beam headlights to increase their field of vision.
questions.explanation: While it is not advisable to drive in fog, if you must drive in foggy conditions, you should drive with the headlights set on dim or use fog lights.

questions.question: You do not have to stop for a school bus that is stopped with its red lights flashing if it is on a private road.
questions.explanation: When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing and stop arm out, other drivers are required to stop. This law applies to drivers traveling on both public and private roads.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerC: Right lane ends.
questions.explanation: Warning signs provide notice to road users of a situation that might not be readily apparent and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to the right lane ending and tells them to prepare for potential merging traffic.

questions.question: The driver's left arm and hand are extended upward. This hand signal means that the driver plans to:
questions.answerC: Come to a stop.
questions.explanation: If a driver's left arm and hand are extended upward, they are indicating that they intend to turn right. Adjust your driving accordingly if following a driver who is using this hand signal.

questions.question: At an intersection with a yield sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop before entering the intersection.
questions.answerB: Yield just to the traffic on the right.
questions.answerC: Yield just to the traffic on the left.
questions.answerD: Slow down and yield the right-of-way to other traffic.
questions.explanation: A yield sign means that you must slow down and yield the right-of-way to traffic in the intersection or roadway you are entering.

questions.question: You may cross solid yellow lines:
questions.answerA: To pass traffic moving in the same direction.
questions.answerC: At any time.
questions.explanation: As a general rule, broken traffic lines may be crossed but solid lines may not. Solid yellow lines may be crossed only when the driver is making a turn.

questions.question: Before turning right on a solid red traffic light, a driver should:
questions.answerA: Slow down and proceed without stopping, if the way is clear.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop, look in both directions, and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and other traffic.
questions.answerC: Maintain their speed because they have the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Unless prohibited by posted signs, you may turn right at a red light. Before making the turn, come to a complete stop, look both ways, and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and other traffic.

questions.question: To ensure that your physical condition does not cause you to drive in an unsafe manner, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep physically fit and have regular physical examinations.
questions.answerB: Know the effect of any medicine on your driving ability.
questions.answerC: Drive within your physical limitations.
questions.explanation: Your physical condition has an important bearing on your ability to drive safely. Drivers should be aware of their physical limitations and only drive if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow if:
questions.answerA: You first come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: You wait until the light changes.
questions.answerC: You are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.
questions.explanation: If you are in a lane corresponding to a signal displaying a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow when the way is clear. This is true whether the arrow is displayed alone or together with another signal.

questions.question: A steady green light at an intersection means that you:
questions.answerA: Must slow down and prepare to stop.
questions.answerB: Must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
questions.answerC: May drive through the intersection if the road is clear.
questions.explanation: A steady green light means you may drive through the intersection if the road is clear. You may also turn right or left on a steady green light unless a sign prohibits the turn. When turning, you must yield to other vehicles and pedestrians within the intersection.

questions.question: When driving under snowy or icy conditions:
questions.answerA: It is safe to use your cruise control.
questions.answerB: Make speed and directional changes more gradually than you would otherwise.
questions.answerC: Drive as you would under normal conditions.
questions.explanation: When driving under snowy or icy conditions, you should make speed and directional changes gradually. Never use cruise control when driving on snow or ice because your tires may lose contact with the road and you will lose control of your vehicle.

questions.question: When double solid yellow lines separate lanes of traffic:
questions.answerA: Passing is permitted from the left.
questions.answerB: Passing is permitted from the right.
questions.answerC: Passing is not permitted from either direction.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separating lanes of traffic indicate that traffic is moving in opposite directions. Double solid lines indicate that passing is not permitted from either direction.

questions.question: Nebraska law requires individuals involved in a crash to report the crash within ____ if any person is injured or killed, or if damages appear to exceed ____ for any vehicle or piece of property.
questions.explanation: A crash must be reported to the Department of Roads within 10 days if it has resulted in any deaths or injuries, or if it appears to have resulted in more than $1,000 in property damage.

questions.question: Any motor vehicle operator convicted of evading arrest for the violation of any Nebraska law can have their license revoked.
questions.explanation: Your driver license may be revoked if you attempt to avoid arrest or citation by fleeing from a law enforcement officer.

questions.question: It is legal to go faster than the speed limit when passing another vehicle.
questions.explanation: It is always unlawful to exceed the posted speed limit, even when passing another vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerC: Roadwork or maintenance is present.
questions.explanation: Orange, diamond-shaped signs are used to mark construction, maintenance, survey, and utility work areas. These signs help direct drivers and pedestrians safely through dangerous zones. Fines for traffic convictions may double in areas marked by these signs.

questions.question: When stopping at an intersection with a stop line, you should:
questions.answerC: Stop in the crosswalk.
questions.explanation: Stop lines are white lines painted across the pavement at intersections. You must stop at the stop line when a pedestrian is present or when a sign or signal requires you to stop.

questions.question: No vehicle may follow any fire apparatus responding to an emergency at a distance closer than:
questions.answerC: 500 feet.
questions.explanation: You may not follow within 500 feet of a fire apparatus that is responding to an emergency. Do not park within a block of where a fire apparatus has stopped to answer an emergency.

questions.question: When passing a bicycle, motorists should provide a space of no less than ____ of clearance.
questions.answerC: Three feet
questions.explanation: By law, motorists are required to provide at least three feet of clearance when overtaking a bicycle. Drivers must maintain clearance until safely past the overtaken bicycle.

questions.question: Various traffic control devices in construction and maintenance work areas are the color:
questions.answerC: Yellow.
questions.explanation: Orange warning signs are used in and around work zones. Use special caution when you see orange signs, cones, or barriers on a roadway.

questions.question: You are waiting in the intersection to complete a left turn. You should:
questions.answerA: Signal and keep your wheels turned to the left.
questions.answerB: Signal and keep your wheels straight.
questions.answerC: Flash your headlights so drivers will let you through.
questions.answerD: Drive around the rear of a car if it blocks you.
questions.explanation: You must always signal before turning or changing lanes. You should keep your wheels straight while waiting to make a left turn. If another vehicle hits you from behind, this ensures that you will not be pushed into oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Traffic signals sometimes display arrows to control turns from specific lanes. A solid yellow arrow:
questions.answerA: Is never used as a traffic signal.
questions.answerB: Has the same meaning as a circular yellow traffic light.
questions.answerC: Means that drivers may turn in the direction indicated by the arrow.
questions.answerD: Tells drivers that a green arrow is about to be shown.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow arrow has the same meaning as a yellow traffic light. When approaching a solid yellow arrow, you must reduce your speed and prepare for a red light.

questions.question: You are driving along a street and hear a siren. You cannot immediately see the emergency vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Keep driving until you see the vehicle.
questions.answerB: Pull to the curb and look to see if it is on your street.
questions.answerC: Slow down. Don't stop until you see it.
questions.answerD: Speed up and turn at the next intersection.
questions.explanation: If you hear a siren or an air horn close by but do not know exactly where the emergency vehicle is, safely pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure it is not headed toward you.

questions.question: In rainy weather, you should be most careful when turning or stopping:
questions.answerA: After it has been raining all day.
questions.answerB: One half hour after it stops raining.
questions.answerC: During the first half hour of rain.
questions.explanation: You should be extra careful when turning and stopping during the first half hour of rain. At this point, the oil from cars has not yet washed off the pavement and could be forming a slippery mixture with the rain.

questions.question: This sign tells a driver that:
questions.answerC: A parking attendant is ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a flag person ahead. Always follow directions given by a flagger. Flaggers normally wear orange or yellow vests, yellow-green shirts, or bright jackets. They use paddles and red flags to direct traffic through the work zone and to let workers or construction vehicles cross the road.
